links.title: The Other Side of Darkness on FanFiction.Net
Pixel and Stephanie Forever on FanFiction.Net

1656.name: Nightgazer333
1656.other_names: Cute Nightgazer Starlight, Cute Kitsune Kaydee The Goddess Of Sex And Perversion And Exhibitionism, Cute Neko Hibiki, Cute Neko Kaydee, Fox the Wanderer, Ariel Schnee, Sexy Neko Hibiki

1707.description: Taleswapper wrote only a single fanfic that I'm aware of, but was more famous for his quarterly and annual Taleswapper Awards, which he handed out to what he considered the best Ranma 1/2 fanfiction he'd read, along with reviews and commentary on the fanfics he nominated.
1707.name: Taleswapper

1759.description: The "High Priest & Founder" of the Church of Ranma and Nabiki (link 1 and link 2).
1759.name: David Houghton

6.description: Unsurprisingly, these are the fanfics that I deemed bad: not worth reading, in my opinion.
6.name: bad

20.description:
Some change has occurred before the story begins.

Usually, this means something substantial about the setup is different. "Usagi woke up five minutes earlier in the first episode and missed meeting Luna" doesn't count. "Usagi was never born" probably does. "The Moon Kingdom is alive and well and ruling the Earth in the modern day" definitely does.
20.name: alternate universe

21.description: These are good stories, worth reading. Something sets these apart from the average fanfic, be it unusually good writing, an especially interesting premise, or something else.
21.name: good

57.description: Stories written in script format, rather than prose. These were common in years past.
57.name: script

70.description:
Proposed in Contact #1 (December 1975). The winners to be published in the following issue. Requirements:

  1. Be as brief as possible (no more than 5 pages, single spaced) and tie in all the details in the scene.
  2. The scene itself must be part of your story - beginning, middle or end is up to you.
  3. Winners will be chosen on the basis of originality, clarity, and adherence to the theme of this fanzine.
  4. Deadline date for submissions is Feb. 15, 1976.

The scene:

Kirk backed out into the corridor. He knew he was trembling; he willed his legs to steady him. A gentle hand touched him on the shoulder and a familiar voice spoke the word, "Captain". Kirk turned to meet the piercing eyes of his First Officer. Pleadingly, he beseeched, "You saw, Spock?"

Spock nodded. "Yes. It is time."

Kirk fought off a rising panic. His hands felt as cold and clammy as the walls around him. He forced himself not to think, to concentrate on his breathing.

Spock lowered his eyes. For an instant he gripped the Captain's shoulder tightly, then he removed his hand. His voice was steady, quiet as he spoke.

"Jim - I'm sorry. I didn't..." He could not go on.
70.name: Contact 1 Challenge

2.description: Harry stumbles upon a dying Draco Malfoy during the final battle and he gives Harry some rather interesting information.

links.title: Only One Defining Moment Please on FanFiction.Net

2.title: Only One Defining Moment Please

3.description: A parody of stories in which Harry emigrates to the US to escape his troubles.

links.title: If Harry Really Did Go To The USA on FanFiction.Net

3.title: If Harry Really Did Go To The USA

58.description: What if Ranma had found an old recipe for a cure back at the Guide's house at the very begining? And what if this recipe had been left dusty and forgotten for a reason?
58.title: Boiled Nyanniichuan

95.description: Ranma is out looking for a place to train when he spies a white robed figure in the abandoned lot.  Yuri.
95.title: Shocked Awake

118.description: Raven explains to Starfire what love is.
118.title: What Is Love?

145.description: The worst thing about Xellos, Lina decided, was that he didn't hate anyone.
145.title: The Worst Thing

147.description: Lina mourns as she meets Xellos for the final time.
147.title: The Last Meeting

162.description: Xellos seeks Lina at her home, to ask her help with an assignment, but he finds her much too ill to help him. Unable--and unwilling--to find another suitable companion, her nurses her back to health.

links.title: Left In a Demon's Care on FanFiction.Net

162.notes: Sequel: Left in a Demon's Care Part 2
162.title: Left In a Demon's Care

163.description: With Lina recovered from her illness, she and Xellos depart for Xellos's assignment. However, there is another wrinkle: Lina is pregnant. As Xellos cares for Lina during their journey, the two grow closer.

links.title: Left in a Demon's Care Part 2 on FanFiction.Net

163.title: Left in a Demon's Care Part 2

191.description: Akane challenges Ranma to a fight. He requires a humiliating penalty of her when she loses.
191.title: FIGHT ME!

198.description: Ranma's daughter asks how her parents got together. An alternate ending to the battle with the Golden Pair.

links.title: I will Never Let you Go on FanFiction.Net

198.title: I will Never Let you Go

206.description: Ranma and Akane are fighting again, but their children show them a video tape that puts things in perspective.
206.title: Video Tape

234.description: Kasumi's touch sparks new feelings in Ranma, which he does not understand. What does it mean, and what will they do about it?
234.title: Touch

244.description: Ranma spent weeks chasing Herb in an effort to get his manhood back. What happens when he finally makes it home?

links.title: A Man I'll Never Be on FanFiction.Net

244.title: A Man I'll Never Be

254.description: Raven is not capable of returning Starfire' love, but Starfire is not discouraged.

links.title: If I Were Capable on FanFiction.Net

254.title: If I Were Capable

259.description: Harry doesn't like people getting his name wrong.

links.title: My Name Is Harry on FanFiction.Net

259.title: My Name Is Harry

265.description: Q explains to some doomed scientists what a mistake it was to experiment with Omega molecules.
265.title: Show and Tell

270.description: Q appears before Picard and whisks him away to... somewhere.
270.notes: The story ends before at all anything happens.
270.title: Space Exploration

272.description: Once again, Q watches while Picard sleeps.
272.title: One Thousand Eyes

274.description: Picard asks Q where he originally got his powers. The answer... is a bit disappointing.
274.title: Rather Disappointing, Really

275.description: Q lectures the crew of the Enterprise on the difference between 'sapient' and 'sentient'.
275.title: Sapient NOT Sentient!

288.description: A common scene: Ranma returns from visiting Ukyou, and Akane accuses him of cheating on her. This time, however, Kasumi snaps, informing the family of who the REAL adulterer is.
288.title: THAT IS ENOUGH!

332.description: Kuno makes a wish - with unexpected consequences.
332.title: Ranko's Ascension

343.description: Wesley knows why Buffy refuses to treat him with the respect and deference he expected.
343.title: Wesley Knew

351.description: Harry has ensured that Snape gets the funeral he deserves. As it draws to a close, he reflects on the man, who was never truly understood.
351.title: Never Forgotten

398.description: Harry and Hermione read Snape's Azkaban Prison report, and they find it contains some very odd things indeed.

links.title: An Abnormal Prison Report on FanFiction.Net

398.title: An Abnormal Prison Report

495.description: What if, Ranma had been born during the 1600's, and on his visit to Jusenkyo, he fell into the spring of Drowned Young Girl. Now, when he is splashed with cold water he turns into a 12 year old girl that never ages, and the only way for him to turn back is with nearly boiling water.
495.notes:
TASS Mini Series Award for August 2000, 3rd place
TASS Mini Series Award for Annual 2000, 4th place
495.title: Destiny's Child

531.description: Nightmare Moon does not allow Twilight Sparkle to use the sixth element of harmony.
531.title: Nighttime Eternal

616.description: During Season 3, Buffy tells Giles that Angel has returned from hell. The revelation is difficult for him to bear.
616.title: The Right Thing

617.description: Giles catches members of the new Watchers' Council engaging in sacrilege that even the old Council would have found beyond the pale.
617.title: An Icy Reception

835.description: After Akane switches the Tendo/Saotome engagement to Nabiki, Ranma reaches the decision to try and learn how to intentionally use whatever it is that attracts girls to him.
835.title: License To Thrill

890.description: In a scheme inspired by Hamlet, Ranma pretends to be mad in order to try to escape his impossible obligations. When Genma attempts to have him actually declared insane, the government steps in, and Ranma takes the opportunity to try to resolve his troubles.

links.title: To Tell a Hawk From a Handsaw on FanFiction.Net

890.title: To Tell a Hawk From a Handsaw

906.description: Percy and Ron have a closer relationship with each other than with their other brothers.
906.title: Ron's Favorite

926.description: Hotaru has a problem that Haruka isn't interested in solving.
926.title: Teenage Trouble

928.description: Haruka has a brilliant idea so simplify her morning routine--but she hasn't quite considered the consequences.
928.title: Stubble

953.description: Only a Slytherin may hug Professor Snape.

links.title: A Slytherin's Guide to Hugging Professor Snape on FanFiction.Net

953.title: A Slytherin's Guide to Hugging Professor Snape

956.description: Harry uses his fame to help capture the escaped pixies during his first DADA class with Lockhart.

links.title: Harry's First Class with Lockhart on FanFiction.Net

956.title: Harry's First Class with Lockhart

990.description: During a fight, Happosai uses a scroll to banish Ranma to face a reaper. The next thing Ranma knows, he is on the planet Therum, standing before Liara T'Soni, who has accidentally trapped herself in a force field.
990.title: An Asari's Horse

1089.description: Snape steps out briefly while supervising Harry's detention and returns to find that his private potions ingredients have been destroyed.
1089.title: Snape's Broken Cabinet

1091.description: The Calming Draught seems like a very useful potion. So what does Snape have against them?
1091.title: Calming Draught

1223.description: EDI asks Garrus if he finds her attractive, which leads him to explain his relationship with Shepard.

links.title: A Question of Attraction on FanFiction.Net

1223.title: A Question of Attraction

1229.description: Shepard didn't lie; not about giving her the files, not about Pragia. She's lying now. She is, she is. Fem!Shep/Jack. Rated M for saucy content.
1229.title: Uninvited

1254.description: EDI asks Shepard a very difficult question.

links.title: The Hardest Of All Questions on FanFiction.Net

1254.title: The Hardest Of All Questions

1338.description: Seeking to learn more about her new status, Twilight asks Celestia for information about alicorn lifespans. She gets more than she bargained for: Celestia reveals a dark secret, and Twilight is the best hope for ending more than forty thousand years of tragedy.
1338.title: Twilight's Final

1759.description: Snape is described as "the Potions master", and Hermione discovers exactly what that means.
1759.title: On Potions Mastery

1815.description: Harry is shocked when Ron doesn't press him for answers about his nighttime activities.
1815.title: Illegal Necromantic Rituals

1830.description: John Shepard's true love was the Normandy. It had been so since he took command while chasing Saren. When Ashley spurned him on Horizon, he found solace in that love. But after the Reaper war began, something happened that changed everything: Edi, the Normandy's AI, acquired a body. Could the Normandy itself, at long last, return his love in kind?

links.title: Mass Effect: For the love of Edi (AU) on FanFiction.Net

1830.title: Mass Effect: For the love of Edi (AU)

1984.description: Ranma has had trouble with a particular time of day, ever since Nabiki pointed out that 11:11 looks like claw marks.
1984.title: 11:11, or Chronophobia

1985.description: Just a bad joke dressed up like a story.
1985.title: Reiji's Anime Joke Time Dai IchiBan

1987.description: "Many think I do not know of the truth of the curse of Ranma Saotome, yet they're wrong."
1987.title: Half a Conversation: New Views

1988.description: A poem inspired by Hearts of Ice (by Krista Perry).
1988.title: Purest Snow and Crimson Blood

1989.description: In the time since Ranma discovered Ryouga's curse, Ranma has learned something about honor.
1989.title: Ryoga's Curse

1990.description: On September 8, 1998, Mark McGwire hit a record-breaking 62nd home run. But where did the ball end up?
1990.title: Non-Reality 1/2

1991.description: Three years ago, Ranma left Nerima and got married. Now he has a child on the way. But it wasn't enough--he still loves Akane.
1991.title: Trapped

1992.description: Nabiki announces that the world is coming to an end. What brought this on?
1992.title: What Happened?

1993.description: What if Ryouga had made it to the fight on the third day?
1993.title: What If... The Fight

1994.description: Ranma has trouble with a particular question on a standardized test.
1994.title: Just a Test

1995.description: Ranma can't get enough of Akane's cooking, ever since she got a new Micronesian cookbook.
1995.title: Akane Can Cook

1996.description: A short poem by Ruth Berman about the titular characters, so different, who "even when they disagree / (And they generally do) / Seek out each other's company."
1996.title: Kirk and Spock

1997.description: A story by Ruth Berman, which places Kirk, Spock, Uhura, and McCoy in the world of Spenser's The Faerie Queene.
1997.notes:
To be perfectly frank, I think that 'drek' gets it about right.

Published in Spockanalia #1.
1997.title: Star Drek

2002.description: A song written by Dorothy Jones. She introduces it as "a piece supposed to have been written by Spock, many years ago." She describes it as a "Vulcan form called ni var" which "means literally 'two form' . . . a piece comparing and contrasting two different things or two aspects of the same thing."
2002.notes:
It's an interesting exercise, but not to my taste as poetry.

Published in Spockanalia #1.
2002.title: The Territory of Rigel

2003.description: An article describing how and why Vulcans should strive to control their emotions.
2003.title: Excerpt from The Young Vulcan's Handbook of Emotional Control

2004.description: A poem by Sherna Comerford on Spock's emotions, or lack thereof. The ending is poignant: "Is life worth this price? / A man-machine would pay no price. / Would die. What logic bids you live?"
2004.title: To a Vulcan

2005.description: An article concerning Vulcan physiology--skin pigment, the circulatory system, pon farr, and more.
2005.title: Physiologica Vulcanensis

2006.description: An article (with a diagram!) speculating on what the Vulcan heart might look like.
2006.title: A Proposed Model of the Vulcan Heart

2007.description: An essay in academic style (with citations in end notes!) considering whether Vulcans experience emotions. It concludes: "It is the firm conviction of the author that Vulcan emotions do exist, however unlike human emotions they may be, and that these cannot be ignored in dealing with that planet's sentient species."
2007.title: Vulcans and Emotions

2008.description: An article offering an explanation to why Spock would lose to Kirk at 3-D chess: he loses on purpose, so the victory will put Kirk "into a frame of mind which is beneficial to his self-image, his efficiency rating, and the well-being of the crew in general."
2008.title: The Vulcan Gambit

2009.description: An article framed as a report by a psychologist analyzing Spock. It speculates that Spock pushes himself so hard because he was never able to please his father, and that he may see Kirk as a kind of substitute father figure.
2009.title: Vulcan Psychology

2010.description: A poem on loving a Vulcan (Spock, in particular).
2010.title: Also to a Vulcan

2011.description: A brief skit, which was later performed at the 1969 Star Trek Con. An absurd bit of interaction between Captain Curt, Mr. Swock, and others on the bridge of the USS Undersize.
2011.title: Spock Shock

2012.description: An article by Devra Michele Langsam speculating on Vulcan culture. Langsam argues that Vulcan children must be raised in small family units and that they probably have no family names, and wonders how Vulcan children might be trained. She speculates on whether Vulcans, who are immune to the effects of alcohol, might have some other sort of drugs which do have an effect.
2012.title: Thoughts on Vulcan Culture

2013.description: In this story, Chekov is portrayed a jerk that sexually harasses the viewpoint character (an Ensign Michaelson).
2013.title: Personal Diary Entries

2014.description: "In a very expensive club on the Moon, two doctors were talking about their most unusual surgery cases." One surgeon recounts how an actor from Hollywood had come to him to have his ears, which had grown to a point after he played a role in a science fiction film, cut back down to their normal shape. But the actor's ears just wouldn't stay rounded...
2014.title: My Name Is Not Paul

2015.description: A poem in Kirk's voice about Spock. A parody of "Trees" by Joyce Kilmer: "I think that I shall never grok / A man as logical as Spock."
2015.title: Star Date: 6721; Condition: Confused

2016.description: The author writes as "Lieutenant Miriam Langsam", offering advice on what life is like on a starship.
2016.title: Message Tape

2017.description: A poem supposedly translated from an old Vulcan language.
2017.title: Vulcan Love Song

2018.description: The author offers up "the Klingon view of Vulcans, and of Vulcan-Terran relations, which is quite faulty." The Klingon opinion is that Vulcans are deceitful and that Earth is "waiting for the day when it will be liberated from the Vulcan yoke" by the Klingons, whose job it is "to spread enlightenment throughout the stars."
2018.title: Communication from Star Fleet Intelligence

2019.description: A story in verse about Spock's reaction to the death of Kirk, following a failed rescue attempt.
2019.title: A Lament for the Unsung Dead

2020.description: A Klingon ship reports on the events of "The Ultimate Computer".
2020.title: Klingon Intelligence Report

2021.description: A story (a 'real person fic', in part) in which Kirk, Spock, and McCoy are somehow accidentally beamed to the (then-) present-day set of Star Trek, filming in progress, and must pretend to be their counterparts (Shatner, Nimoy, and Kelley) until they can be rescued.
2021.notes:
Great literature it's not, but it's a serviceable bit of comedy. This story would have a number of sequels by different authors.

Published in Spockanalia #3.
2021.title: Visit to a Weird Planet

2022.description: Primarily about how to fit costumes for the members of the bridge crew.
2022.title: Duty Briefing: Stores and Supply

2023.description: Following from Shirley Meech's article of the same name, this article suggests physical exercises which the young Vulcan should perform in order to maintain a healthy body.
2023.title: Excerpt from The Young Vulcan's Handbook of Emotional Control

2024.description: This reads rather like the equivalent contract for a college dorm room.
2024.title: Terms and Conditions of Residence aboard a Starship Class Vessel

2025.description: A very interesting essay that posits that the Vulcans turned to logic (which, it notes, does not have the usual English meaning) because they once suffered under a regime similar to that depicted in 1984, so Vulcan "logic" is an antidote to Orwell's crimestop, blackwhite, and doublethink.
2025.title: The Vulcan Reforms

2026.description: It does what the title says. The opening: "Vulcan is an isolating language; no word ever changes its form. Grammatical meaning (as opposed to lexical, or dictionary, meaning) is expressed by word order and the use of particles."
2026.title: Proposed Structural Sketch of the Vulcan Language

2027.description: One day aboard the Enterprise, Spock encounters a mysterious bit of yellow string.
2027.notes:
Fanlore informs me that this is "a very creditable imitation of John Lennon's humorous style, as if Lennon were narrating a Star Trek episode". I don't know anything about that, but it's very absurd and amusing.

Published in Spockanalia #3.
2027.title: The Mysterious Yellow String

2028.description: Features a half-Vulcan (her mother Vulcan, her father human) called T'Lian, or else Lt. Commander Lian Jamison, who has had a brief affair with Spock on account of his pon farr.
2028.title: Time Enough

2029.description: What it says on the tin. Letters to Kirk's and Spock's parents, to be generated multiple-choice style.
2029.title: The Multiple-Choice-Instant-Letter-to-Home

2030.description: William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, and DeForest Kelley are accidentally transported to the Star Trek universe during filming.
2030.title: Visit to a Weird Planet Revisited

2031.description: Kirk has lost an arm and been grounded as a result.
2031.title: Straw Death

2032.description: A series of communications from Starfleet as the bureaucracy attempts to sort out McCoy's marriage status following "For the World is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky".
2032.title: Are You Married, Dr. McCoy?

2033.description: Spock and another, perhaps McCoy, are trapped following a cave-in, and discuss Spock's emotions and logic.
2033.title: Cave-In

2034.description: Mirror Spock has betrayed Mirror Kirk; he seeks to save his life, as the government Kirk leads crumbles.
2034.title: To Summon the Future

2035.description: The Eldila from C. S. Lewis's Space Trilogy have a task for Spock.
2035.title: The Skyborn

2036.description: John Smith Togib, president of the Union to Preserve the Humanity of the Federation, writes a letter explaining why aliens cannot be trusted.
2036.title: Crank Letter

2037.description: A story about a human woman and her Vulcan husband.
2037.title: Family Affair

2038.description: A Vulcan woman, T'Prais, transfers aboard the Enterprise. A man, Lieutenant Richards, becomes obsessed with her, transfers her under his command, and generally harasses her and won't leave her alone. This is all apparently very romantic, because the story ends with him asserting that she is going to marry him whether she likes it or not and forcing a kiss on her which was "apparently, perfectly acceptable".
2038.title: Variation On An Unoriginal Theme

2039.description: Spock is in a comatose state following a dangerous event. The decision is made to transfer him permanently off-ship for care. Before he is sent away, he awakens--mentally alert, but physically trapped in an unresponsive body. Nurse Chapel notices this--but says nothing.
2039.title: The Price of a Handful of Snowflakes

2040.description: The Enterprise receives a communication from a secret research base. They have stored in their computer orders to render any aid the base requires, no questions asked, so they proceed to rendezvous with the planet to pick up some personnel that they have been asked to house for a few days. When they receive the list of personnel, they learn that it is almost entirely composed of children--the children of the scientists on the research base.
2040.title: Research

2042.description: Due to a transporter accident, Spock and McCoy swap bodies.
2042.title: People Who Live in Glass Houses Shouldn't...

2043.description: Ranma can admit, now that death has separated them, that he loves Akane.
2043.title: Regrets after it's too late

2044.description: It turns out that there are advantages to using a wooden sword.
2044.title: The Blue Blunder of Furinkan High

2045.description: Akane uses her mallet in defense of the Titanic.
2045.title: Akane Vs. The Iceberg

2046.description: Ranma is defeated... on the TV quiz game show "The Weakest Link".
2046.title: Ranma's Only Lost Battle

2047.description: A song to the tune of "Mexican Radio" by Wall Of Voodoo.
2047.title: Training Ground Jusenkyo

2048.description: Looking up at the stars, Ryouga admits than Ranma is a better man than him, and resolves to somehow redeem himself.
2048.title: Lamenting Ryouga

2049.description: Digging through Genma's pack, Ranma discovers a crystal that speaks to him: "Greetings Kal-el, I am Jor-el, your true father."
2049.title: True Origins

2051.description: Ranma's wife dies as he looks on, along with the girl who will marry him after his wife is dead.

links.title: Learn to Stop Reading Into It on FanFiction.Net

2051.title: Learn to Stop Reading Into It

2052.description: Kodachi returns home from the Tendo Dojo and asks Sasuke to take off her clothes. A jokefic.
2052.title: Take Off My Clothes

2053.description: Ranma decides to repay Genma for the neko-ken training by teaching him the sister form--the dog-fist.
2053.title: Paws for Effect

2054.description: Akane overhears her father in the bathroom teaching Ranma something that must be perverted.
2054.title: Perverts?!

2055.description: Ranma hits his head and once again believes he is really a girl. Shampoo brings a cure meant to change his personality, but Kasumi accidentally eat it and decides to go out for a night on the town. The others try to catch up to her before she does something she'll regret.
2055.title: Ranma 1/2 Version 3.1

2056.description: Akane has given Ranma to Nabiki, who is only interested in him as a way of getting one over on Akane. Between that knowledge and a persistent headache, Ranma is fed up, and goes to Cologne for help getting out of the Tendo agreement. After Cologne drugs the Tendos with a True Feelings potion, Kasumi decides to deal with the situation herself.
2056.title: The Bet - Iinazuke Sankai Suru

2057.description: Women are always throwing themselves at Ranma. What if Ranma really were, as Mousse calls him, an 'enemy of women'?
2057.title: Enemy of Women

2061.description: When Genma was still training under Happosai, he got in a spot of trouble with a woman, Shiori Yamazaki. To get out of it, he made an agreement that if he should have a daughter, he would give her up to be raised by Shiori. Years later, Shiori finds that Genma seem to have hidden a daughter, Ranma, from her, and decides that having one of her sons marry Ranma will satisfy the agreement. So she sends her sons out to retrieve their potential bride.
2061.title: You Can Never Have Too Many...

2063.description: Soun's family sends him to Hawaii to attend a martial arts seminar, in hopes of snapping him out of his grief. He thinks it won't do any good, but then he meets a blonde woman with three daughters of her own...
2063.title: The Tendou Bunch

2067.description: Ranma has a plan to rid himself of Kuno by convincing him that the pigtailed girl is in love with someone else. So what if she has to kiss Ryouga to sell it? And if at first you don't succeed...
2067.title: Ranma's Boyfriend

2100.description: Ryouga stumbles across a 13-year-old girl being attacked by a vampire and rescues her.
2100.notes: Though the title indicates a Buffy crossover, there's nothing Buffy-related besides a vampire.
2100.title: A Martial Artist in Sunnydale

2101.description: Or, "Don't Call Me Pigtailed Girl!!!". Not all redheads have as much patience as Ranma-chan.
2101.title: Kunou Wipes Nerima Off the Map!

2102.description: Akane protests when Shampoo calls Nabiki 'Yakuza-girl', and offers to give her a language lesson. Though perhaps Akane is the one who needed the lesson.
2102.title: Language Lesson

2103.description: Ranma and Ukyou are happily married... with the help of a special 'spice'.
2103.title: Ranma the Addict

2104.description: An otaku decides to get his revenge on the world by jumping in the spring of drowned Microsoft founder.
2104.title: Otaku No Microsoft!

2107.description: Mara has disguised herself as Gill Bats in order to release Windows 69, a piece of software so buggy that it may destroy the universe.
2107.title: Skuld 95

2113.description: Farmer Smurf discovers what looks like human power armor, but sized like a smurf. Inside is a girl with red-brown eyes.
2113.title: Untitled

2114.description: Itachi and Sasuke carry on a correspondence.

links.title: Dear Foolish Little Brother on FanFiction.Net

2114.title: Dear Foolish Little Brother

2116.description: As Ranma's senses become more acute, he begins to detect the cosmic horrors that lurk at the edges of reality.
2116.title: Dancing

2133.description: During one of Ranma's fights, Kasumi's most treasured possession, an urn given to her by her mother, is destroyed, putting their developing friendship in jeopardy. To cap off Ranma's terrible day, he is seriously injured that evening and returns home to find Tofu confessing his love to Kasumi.
2133.notes: This story had potential, but died before the plot could take off.
2133.title: Heirloom

2136.description: Ryouga seduces Akane after the failed wedding, so Ranma decides to make a clean break with them. With the aid of Dr. Tofu, Ranma creates a new life for herself as a woman.
2136.title: Kikuko

2137.description: With the rest of the family out of the house, Kasumi and Ranma are left home alone for the weekend. Kasumi gets sick after she is caught out in the rain, and while Ranma cares for her they come to realize they care for each other.
2137.title: Caring For Kasumi

2164.description: Akane and Ranma have grown apart, and Ranma's other fiancees and rivals have slowly left Nerima. Without the constant pressure, Ranma's skills have stagnated, so he intends to leave, after Akane goes away to college. But Kasumi doesn't want to be the only one left behind with an empty life, either.
2164.title: I'm Here

2167.description: Seeing Michiru talking to Mamoru, Haruka gets jealous.

links.title: All Things Shall Be Peace on FanFiction.Net

2167.title: All Things Shall Be Peace

2171.description: Ranma and Kasumi sneak away to a hotel to indulge their passion.
2171.title: Shared Secrets

2214.description: A man tells his co-worker a joke featuring a man named Tendo and his three daughters.
2214.title: Stop Me If You've Heard This

2215.description: An old woman gives a young martial artist advice about his multiple fiancees.
2215.title: The Voice of Experience

2260.description: Ryouga realizes that Ranma doesn't just survive the chaos around him--he loves it, encourages it. Ryouga can't bear to let Ranma keep making people miserable for the sake of having a challenge, but how can he beat him?

links.title: I Was Right All Along on FanFiction.Net

2260.title: I Was Right All Along

2261.description: Naruto has developed a more powerful variation on his Sexy no Jutsu that works on women. When he demonstrates it on Ino, things... develop.
2261.title: Kiss and Yell

2262.description: Sakura and Naruto have been together for ten years, but he has never proposed to her. She has finally had enough of this, and confronts him.
2262.title: A Scandalous Proposal

2278.description: Ranma tells his mother about Akane sleeping with P-chan, and she is upset enough to demand that he honor the seppuku contract. Fortunately, Hild sends Mara to rescue Ranma at the last moment, with orders to keep him safe and bring him around to their way of thinking. So Ranma ends the night by moving into an apartment with Mara.

links.title: Out of the Frying Pan on FanFiction.Net

2278.title: Out of the Frying Pan

2281.description: Ranma explains to Ryouga that he has come to accept his curse.
2281.title: Realization

2282.description: Only one person has remembered Ranma's birthday--but one can be enough.
2282.title: Ranma's Birthday

2301.description: Ranma has begun fainting whenever he insults Akane, even before she hits him. Is there a cure, or will he have to start being nicer to his fiancee?
2301.notes: Published in the 1994 print collection Not In Your Wildest Dreams.
2301.title: Better Late than Never

2303.description: Shampoo sends a letter to Ranma offering him a free meal. On his way to the Nekohanten, he's joined by Ryouga, Mousse, and Genma, who want to take advantage of the free food, as well. They all eat the ramen Shampoo makes for Ranma, and that night, they all have unusual dreams.
2303.title: Ranma no Yume or Ranma's Dream

2314.description: Spock decides to help Kirk forget Rayna--for both of their sakes.
2314.title: Painful Memories

2322.description: A love poem from one Vulcan to another.
2322.title: Vulcan Love Poem

2323.description: Spock and Christine are on their first shore leave since bonding, when things go horribly wrong.

links.title: The Sting of Mortality on FanFiction.Net

2323.title: The Sting of Mortality

2327.description: The Knight Gordon has arrived to rescue the young girls kidnapped by Xellos. But Xellos isn't behaving quite the way he expected. What is he really after?

links.title: If You Want to Call It That on FanFiction.Net

2327.title: If You Want to Call It That

2329.description: Buffy seems a bit too concerned for Giles, after his failed attack on Angelus, so he confronts her about it, and learns about the fate of Buffy's previous watcher, Merrick.
2329.title: Déjà vu

2342.description: Valentine's Day is coming up. What gifts will Akane and Ranma give each other?
2342.title: A Gift for Her?!?

2347.description: Nabiki and Ranma fall in love, and work together to rid Ranma of his unwanted fiancees. Cologne will not give in easily, however.
2347.title: Understanding

2485.description: "Star light, star bright..." Sasami wishes upon a star.
2485.title: Sasami's Wish

2486.description: Washu learns something about Mihoshi, and Tenchi's love life becomes less complicated.
2486.title: Just Another Day

2487.description: A song to the tune of Blink 182's "What's My Age Again?".

links.title: Who's My Girlfriend Again? on FanFiction.Net

2487.title: Who's My Girlfriend Again?

2488.description: When they learned that Sasami would grow up to be very beautiful, Ryouko and Aeka began to consider her a competitor for Tenchi's heart. They might be right.
2488.title: A Sasami/Tsunami&Tenchi Fanfiction

2495.description: Washu needs some supplies. Fortunately, the shop offers a senior discount.
2495.title: Senior discount?

2496.description: Tenchi isn't quite sure how to respond when Mayuka asks who her mother is.
2496.title: Who's my Mommy?

2497.description: A poem in Washu's voice about herself and her life in the Masaki household.
2497.title: Washu's Declaration

2500.description: Kiyone gives Sasami a Dreamcast. Sasami and Ryouko play together, and Ayeka gets jealous.

links.title: Sasami gets a Dreamcast on FanFiction.Net

2500.title: Sasami gets a Dreamcast

2534.description: The Enterprise has been destroyed. McCoy is dead. Scott is dead. Kirk has been lost somewhere. Eventually Spock finds him, "paralyzed, catatonic, unable to face the loss of his ship" and brings him to Vulcan. Kirk eventually recovers, becomes more Vulcan-like, bonds with his Vulcan healer, and, to top it all off, experiences pon farr.
2534.notes: A winner of the Contact 1 challenge. Published in Contact #2.
2534.title: The Logic of Chance

2535.description: Kirk falls in love with and is married to an empath, Sandra Pendrake--Sandy. Though Kirk has no telepathic abilities himself, he has become "'psionically attuned' from his various experiences with such creatures/entities as Sargon" as well has by melding with Spock. So, as a wedding gift, Spock offers to psychically bond Kirk and Sandy to allow them to truly share themselves with one another. Kirk accepts, and the two are deliriously happy. Then an accident occurs on a routine mission, and Sandy is dying, painfully, and taking Kirk with her. So Spock unbonds them and comforts Kirk.
2535.notes: A winner of the Contact 1 challenge. Published in Contact #2.
2535.title: Death is Only a Parting

1.name: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic

2.description: A martial arts comedy manga and anime created by Takahashi Rumiko.
2.name: Ranma 1/2
